### Power of SW test for different distributions
```{r}
par(mar = c(4.5, 4.1, 4.1, 8.0), xpd = TRUE)
plot(nvec, power_data$Exponential.SW, type="l", lwd= 2, col = "red", 
     ylim = c(0.0, 1.0),xlab = "Sample Size", ylab = "Power")
lines(nvec, power_data$Laplace.SW, lwd= 2, col = "blue")
lines(nvec, power_data$Chi.Square.SW,lwd= 2, col = "gold")
lines(nvec, power_data$Gamma.SW,lwd= 2, col = "green")
lines(nvec, power_data$Weibull.SW, col = "coral4")
lines(nvec, power_data$t, col = "orange")
lines(nvec, power_data$LogNormal.SW, col = "deeppink")
lines(nvec, power_data$Standard.Normal.SW, col = "yellow")
lines(nvec, power_data$Contaminated.SW, col = "purple")
lines(nvec, power_data$Uniform.SW, col = "cyan")
title(main = "Power of SW test Under Different Distribution")
legend("topright", inset = c(-0.3, 0), legend=c("Exp", "Laplace", "Chisq", "Gamma", "Weibull", "t", "LogNormal","Std Normal", "contaminate", "Uniform"),
       col=c( "red","blue", "gold", "green", "coral4", "orange", "deeppink", "yellow", "purple", "cyan"), lty =1,cex = 0.8, title = "Distribution")
```



### Comparison of Power of Different Normality Tests
```{r}
par(mar = c(5.0, 4.0, 4.0, 6.5), xpd = TRUE)
plot(nvec, power_data$Exponential.KS, type="l", lwd= 2, col = "red", 
     ylim = c(0.0, 1.0),xlab = "Sample Size", ylab = "Power")
lines(nvec, power_data$Exponential.SW, lwd= 2, col = "blue")
lines(nvec, power_data$Exponential.JB,lwd= 2, col = "gold")
lines(nvec, power_data$Exponential.DAP,lwd= 2, col = "green")
lines(nvec, power_data$Exponential.AD, col = "coral4")
lines(nvec, power_data$Exponential.SF, col = "deeppink")
title(main = "Comparison of Power of Different Normality Tests")
legend("topright", inset = c(-0.2, 0), legend=c("KS", "SW", "JB", "DAP", "AD", "SF"),
       col=c( "red","blue", "gold", "green", "coral4", "deeppink"), lty =1,cex = 0.8, title = "Test Method")
```


### Utility of SW test
```{r}
par(mar = c(6.8, 4.1, 3.1, 5.1), xpd = TRUE)
plot(nvec, power_data$Standard.Normal.SW, axes=FALSE, ylim=c(0.0,0.9), xlab="", ylab="", 
   type="b",col="black", main="Utility of Shapiro Wilk test")
axis(2, ylim=c(0,1),col="black",las=1)  
mtext("Power of SW test",side=2,line=2.5)
lines(nvec, power_data$Uniform.SW,   xlab="", ylab="", ylim=c(-0.2,1.0), 
     type="b", col="red")
lines(nvec, power_data$t,   xlab="", ylab="", ylim=c(-0.2,1.0), 
     type="b", col="green")
lines(nvec, power_data$Laplace.SW,   xlab="", ylab="", ylim=c(-0.2,1.0), 
     type="b", col="blue")
box()
par(new=TRUE)

plot(nvec, powerloss_data$Standard.Normal.0.5,  xlab="", ylab="", ylim=c(-0.3,0.5), 
    axes=FALSE, type="b", col="black")
mtext("Power loss of t test",side=4,col="black",line=4) 
axis(4, ylim=c(0,0.5), col="black",col.axis="black",las=1)
lines(nvec, powerloss_data$Uniform.0.5,   xlab="", ylab="", ylim=c(-0.3,0.5), 
     type="b", col="red")
lines(nvec, powerloss_data$t.0.5,   xlab="", ylab="", ylim=c(-0.3,0.5), 
     type="b", col="green")
lines(nvec, powerloss_data$Laplace.0.5,   xlab="", ylab="", ylim=c(-0.3,0.5), 
     type="b", col="blue")
axis(4, ylim=c(0,0.2), col="red",col.axis="red",las=1)
axis(1,pretty(range(sample_size),10))
mtext("Sample Size",side=1,col="black",line=2.5)  
legend("bottom", inset = c(0, -0.5), legend=c("Normal","Uniform", "t", "LapLace"),
  col=c("black","red", "green", "blue"), lty = 5, horiz = TRUE)
```
